description:
Variation of conditions 5 (restricted access from Weimar Street)  pursuant to planning permission dated 04/07/1995 ref 95/W/0036  (Change of use of building adjacent to 2 Weimar Street to a food and drink establishment in conjunction with 22 Putney High Street, together with the erection of an external flue duct running up the rear wall of no. 20 Putney High Street.) to allow access to Weimar Street for deliveries/collections.

[amended description]
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The Class E(b) use at the rear of 20-26 Putney High Street shall only be used in connection with the premises at 22 Putney High Street. There shall be no customer access from the rear Weimar Street entrance and this entrance point shall be used solely for access for collecting delivery food from the restaurant, and only when carried out in full accordance with the submitted Delivery and Servicing Management Plan REV: A dated April 2022, in addition to its use in the event of emergencies.
To protect the amenities of neighbours.
Condition : 2 - The Weimar Street entrance to the property shall not be used for collections other than between the hours of: 0900 and 2200 Monday to Sunday
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.
Condition : 3 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of planning permission dated 04/07/1995 ref 95/W/0036  
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 4 - Details of plans and materials to be used for sound insulation between the ground floor restaurant at 22 Putney High Street and the first floor shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority and installed before the flats are occupied.
To protect the amenities of neighbours.

This condition was discharged under application: 95/W/0695

Condition : 5 - Full details of the proposed ducting (which shall terminate 1.0m above the eaves) shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before installation, and shall be removed when the permitted use terminates.
To ensure the satisfactory treatment of these details.

Condition : 6 - The food and drink establishment shall not be open to the public other than between the hours of 1000 to 2400 and at no other time.
To protect the amenities of neighbours.

Condition : 7 - The open area in front of the building facing onto Weimar Street shall not be used by customers or staff of the A3 use hereby permitted without the prior written approval of the local planning authority. 
To protect the amenities of neighbours

Condition : 8 - All refuse shall be stored in the indicated storage area. 
To protect the amenities of the area
Condition : 9 - The proposed disabled toilets shall be installed in accordance with the submitted details and permanently retained thereafter.
To ensure the provision of these facilities
Condition : 10 - Full details of any advertisements to be displayed on the Weimar Street frontage shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before the use commences, nothwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking, amending or re-enacting that Order)
To control the appearance of the building.

Condition : 11 - Noise emissions from any compressors, air conditioners, fans or other plant shall not exceed the ambient back ground noise levels measured at the boundary of the site and the windows on the floor above.
To protect the amenities of neighbours.
Condition : 12 - Music shall not be played within the premises at such a level as would make it audible outside the premises or within the residential unit above
To protect the amenities of the area and residential unit above.
Condition : 13 - Notwithstanding what is shown on the approved plans, details of the treatment to the Weimar Street frontage shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before the use commences. No alteration shall take place to the approved details without the prior written consent of the local planning authority.
In order that the local planning authority may be satisfied as to these details in the interests of visual amenity in accordance with Policy DMS1 of the DMPD.
Condition : 14 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
